Name: Drone
Description: Produces 1 $G every turn; Transforms into an adult critter

Name: Larva
Description: Transforms into Drone

Name: Crab
Description: Defending: +2 \M
Lore: Walks sideways.

Name: Firefly
Description: Produces 1 $F every turn

Name: Mosquito
Lore: My favorite creatures are centaurs.; They have six limbs, which makes them insect, just like me.

Name: Queen
Description: Produces additional Larva every turn

Name: Scorpion
Description: Win combat: give Venom to enemy creature
Lore: Round 1; Fight; There is no justice.

Name: Spider
Description: Win combat: give Cobweb to enemy creature

Name: Cobweb
Description: Cannot be given directly

Name: Venom
Description: Cannot be given directly

Name: Critters race
Description: Critters creatures cannot have any items
Lore: Arthropods are a diverse group of invertebrates that includes insects, arachnids, crustaceans, and many other types of animals.

Name: Sacrificial Shrine
Description: Gain 1 $F whenever own creature is sacrificed or killed
Lore: The fires are bright and full of screams.

Name: Cerberus
Description: Win combat: gain 1 $F
Lore: What is more than 1 head? Two heads!; What is more than 2 heads? Three heads!

Name: Imp
Description: Produces 1 $F every turn
Lore: Caring for the fires is my pleasure.

Name: Succubus
Description: Combat: target enemy creature; That creature does not participate in this combat
Lore: Pleasure beyond life.

Name: Balrog
Description: Produces 1 $F every turn; +1 \M for every $F you own
Lore: Dark fire avails him, the flame of Udun, servant of shadows.

Name: Mephisto
Description: Grants -1 \F to all creatures, own and enemy
Lore: All worlds will fall before the burning standards of Hell. I have seen it.

Name: Corrupt Soul Gem
Description: Gain 2 $M

Name: Desecrated Urn
Description: Give to own or enemy creature

Name: Embers
Description: Produces 1 $F every turn
Lore: Made in the hell, burns forever.

Name: Incantation Scroll
Description: Produces 1 $M every turn
Lore: Malla, Eer, Dul, Aman, Shala, Ros, Ackra, Sheer, Thalla, Salthrak, Imar, Kalador, Anâ€™perath, Oâ€™sakana, Ferik, ...

Name: Break
Description: Destroy item, own or enemy
Lore: Your staff is broken.

Name: Burn
Description: Destroy 2 enemy $G or $M

Name: Curse
Description: Combat: target enemy creature; That creature has its attributes halved (rounds toward zero) until end of the combat
Lore: Death is the only way to lift the curse.

Name: Illusion
Description: Target own creature; Create temporary creature with same tags and attributes as printed on the target; It is removed at the end of the turn or combat

Name: Possess
Description: Sacrifice (remove from game) own demonic creature; Steal enemy creature

Name: Unholly Might
Description: Combat: all creatures (own and enemy) with negative \F gain +1 \M, with positive \F gain -1 \M

Name: Unthinkable
Description: Sacrifice (remove from game) own artifact

Name: Angel
Lore: I saw the angel in the marble and carved until I set her free.

Name: Deity
Description: +1 \F for every other creature with positive \F
Lore: Fueled by prayers.

Name: Jinn
Lore: Smokeless flame with free will - what could possibly go wrong?

Name: Oracle
Description: Produces 1 $M every turn
Lore: You've already made the choice. You're here to understand why you've made it.

Name: Titan
Description: +1 \M for every other divine creature
Lore: In the name of god, we fight.

Name: Buddha
Description: Final: convert all \M and \C to \F
Lore: The faith is absolute.

Name: Loki
Description: Keep played spell cards in your hand
Lore: I love it when a plan comes together, even if it's someone else's.

Name: Holy Chalice
Description: +2 \F if you have Holy Water

Name: Holy Water
Description: +2 \M if enemy has any undead creature
Lore: Tastes like tap water.

Name: Elder Wand
Description: Produces 1 $M every turn; Immediately win if you have all three deathly hallows

Name: Blessing
Description: Combat: target own creature; That creature has its attributes doubled until end of the combat

Name: Counterspell
Description: Play immediately after enemy spell to cancel it; Cannot cancel Counterspell
Lore: Expelliarmus

Name: Creation
Description: Draw 5 cards

Name: Lightning Bolt
Description: Kill enemy creature
Lore: Death as fast as light.

Name: Omniscience
Description: Opponent reveals their hand untill end of your turn

Name: Resurrect
Description: Resurrect own dead non-undead non-demonic creature
Lore: The stars wheeled overhead, and every day was as long as a life age of the earth. But it was not the end. I felt life in me again. I've been sent back until my task is done.

Name: Time Dilation
Description: Play additional turn immediately after you finish this turn

Name: Dwarf Fortress
Description: Defending: +2 \M
Lore: Booze does all the work in forts.; Dwarves are just booze exoskeletons.

Name: Explosive Trap
Description: Place additional creature or building; Defending: +3 \M; Remove the trap from the game after the combat
Lore: There are four wires: red, green, yellow, and another red.; They all cause detonation.; There is no disarming the trap.

Name: Guild
Description: Game end: spend all $G to gain same amount in one of \M/\C/\F
Lore: Money buys you anything.

Name: Iron Forge
Description: Always have all own $F on this card; Produces $F equal to half of $F on this card (rounds down)

Name: Talos Automaton
Description: Defending: +4 \M
Lore: Talos is the Sun.

Name: Vault
Description: Always have all own $G on this card; Produces $G equal to half of $G on this card (rounds down)
Lore: Gems and money is what makes a dwarf happy.

Name: Zeppelin
Description: Opponent must reveal first two cards they draw in their Cards phase

Name: Blacksmith
Description: Grant +1 \M to all other dwarf creatures
Lore: Tailor for the wealthy.; I mean... for the dwarfs.; ...; For wealthy dwarfs.

Name: Miner
Description: Produces 1 $G every turn
Lore: The spirits of the earth guide me.; You mean metal ores.; Of course.

Name: Gimli
Description: Game end: grant +2 \M to all other dwarf creatures
Lore: Iâ€™m wasted on cross-country. We dwarves are natural sprinters. Very dangerous over short distances.

Name: Boomstick
Lore: Good. Bad. I'm the guy with the gun.

Name: Booze
Lore: If it's not made of stone or metal, it should be made of beer.

Name: Jewel
Lore: Antique ruby pendant with perfect diamond cut, flawless clarity and deep red color, 3 carats.

Name: Mithril
Description: Defending: +2 \M
Lore: The mithril coat shone like moonlit silver, and it was woven with enchantments that made it strong as steel, but light as a feather.

Name: Repair
Description: Repair (resurrect) own dead building

Name: Dwarf Race
Lore: Dwarves delved too greedily and too deep, and awoken shadow and flame, that is too great of a foo.

Name: Fangorn Forest
Description: Grants +1 \M to all Ents and Druids

Name: Sacred Grove
Description: Grants +1 \F to all Entwives and Dryads

Name: Yggdrasil
Lore: Greatest civilizations are grown from the ashes of their foes.

Name: Druid
Description: Produces 1 $M every turn; +1 \C for each Dryad
Lore: One tree, two trees, tree threes, ... three trees, ... I have to stop playing the dies, ... the dices ...

Name: Dryad
Description: +1 \C for each Druid
Lore: Nature is restless.

Name: Ent
Description: Produces 1 $G every turn; +1 \C for each Entwife
Lore: You see, we lost the entwives.

Name: Entwife
Description: +1 \C for each Ent
Lore: I am right here, you dumb***.

Name: Galadriel
Description: Game end: spend all $G to gain same amout in \C, spend all $M to gain \F
Lore: Light of the White Tree of Valinor, made by Valar, is reflected in her eyes, for she is the last survivor who has seen it.

Name: Legolas
Description: Combat: kill enemy creature at the beginning of the combat
Lore: A red sun rises. Blood has been spilled this night.

Name: Lembas
Lore: One small bite is enough to fill the stomach of a grown man.

Name: Mirror Fountain
Lore: The mirror shows many things.; Things that were. Things that are. And some things that have not yet come to pass.

Name: Invisibility Cloak
Description: Prevents its wearer from being targeted by opponents spells; Immediately win if you have all three deathly hallows
Lore: No peeping!

Name: Elf Race
Lore: Elves shall be the fairest of all earthly creatures, and they shall have and shall conceive and bring forth more beauty than all others, and they shall have the greater bliss in this world.; Also pointy ears!

Name: Castle
Description: Defending: +2 \M
Lore: Draw bridge, machicolations, murder holes, hoardings, arrowslits, bartizans, embrasures, merlons, ...

Name: Temple
Lore: In nomine Patris et Filii et Spiritus sancti.

Name: Trebuchet
Lore: I'm TNT! I'm dynamite!

Name: Workshop
Description: Produces $G equal to number of your Craftsmans every turn
Lore: If it is not working it needs more tape. Thats it.

Name: Craftsman
Lore: I'm being repressed!

Name: Knight
Lore: Damn helmet, can't seem to get this thing...

Name: Monk
Description: Combat: the Monk uses \F in place of \M
Lore: Wololo.

Name: Peasant
Description: Produces 1 $G every turn
Lore: Ready for work!; ...; Work, again?

Name: Priest
Description: Produces 1 $M every turn
Lore: One ring to rule them all, one ring to find them. One ring to bring them all, ...; Sorry, wrong book.

Name: Saboteur
Description: Place into opponents play
Lore: Ready to take things apart.

Name: Thief
Description: Steal item from enemy creature and give it to the Thief
Lore: I'll relieve them of their burden!; I'm a professional.

Name: Wizard
Lore: You shall not pass!

Name: ThÃ©oden
Description: Grants +1 \M to all own human creatures and buildings
Lore: Where is the horse and the rider? Where is the horn that was blowing? They have passed like rain on the mountain, like wind in the meadow. The days have gone down in the West behind the hills into shadow. How did it come to this?

Name: Bible
Lore: And God said, â€œLet there be light,â€ and there was light.

Name: Book of Poems
Description: +2 \C if you have Mandolin
Lore: Time doesnâ€™t heal wounds to make you forget.; Time leaves you with a scar to remind you of how you bled.

Name: Drama Mask
Lore: To be, or not to be, that is the question.

Name: Hookah
Lore: Eternal Smoke Dark Bean; Social Smoke Berry Punch; Starbuzz Blue Mist

Name: Mandolin
Description: +2 \C if you have Book of Poems
Lore: ğ„ ğ„°ğ†”ğ… ğ…—ğ…—ğ†•ğ„— ğ„½ğ„…ğ‡“ğ…¡ğ… ğ„¬ğ…£ğ„¬ğ†•ğ…—ğ…¯ğ†ªğ…  ğ„†ğ… ğ…ğ„½ğ… ğ…¡ğ…—ğ…¡ ğ†•ğ„¬ğ„¬ğ†¾ğ‡“ğ… ğ…¡ğ…¡ğ„‡ ğ†”ğ…ğ…—ğ„½ğ…—ğ… ğ…—ğ…ğ…

Name: Mushroom Stew
Lore: Do you see the dragon?; No, but there is a unicorn staring at me.

Name: Doppelganger
Description: Play immediately after enemy spell that targets a creature; Choose another creature with same owner as replacement target for that spell

Name: Human Race
Lore: Mediocre in all respects.; Except honor. Humans have no honor.

Name: Labyrinth
Description: +2 \C if you have Minotaur
Lore: There is great treasue at the end. There is great minotaur in the way.

Name: Banshee
Description: Target enemy creature; Destroy 2 resource tokens on the target
Lore: You shall reunite with your former friends now.

Name: Centaur
Lore: How do you wear pants?; I dont.

Name: Cyclop
Lore: King among blind.

Name: Dragon
Description: Produces 1 $F every turn; Kill enemy creature or building
Lore: Look, I made an obsidian.

Name: Faerie
Lore: The fairest of them all.

Name: Griffin
Lore: Stand straight, walk proud, have a little faith.

Name: Harpy
Lore: I smell magic in the air.; Or maybe barbecue.

Name: Hydra
Description: Win combat: grows additional head; +2 \M for each head
Lore: One neck down, two more to go.

Name: Medusa
Description: Kill enemy non-undead creature
Lore: Do not look into a mirror, lest you want to be preserved in stone forever.

Name: Minotaur
Description: +2 \M if you have Labyrinth
Lore: I am not a cyclop. I have two eyes.

Name: Phoenix
Description: Gain 1 $F token when resurrected; Turn end: resurrect if dead
Lore: Let the fire burn away what no longer serves you.

Name: Satyr
Description: Steal random card from opponents hand
Lore: Revelry, wine, and music.

Name: Troglodyte
Description: Draw 2 cards
Lore: Twolobite, ... trilobite, ... troglodyte!

Name: Unicorn
Description: Produces 1 $M every turn
Lore: Rainbows! Pink!

Name: Werehuman
Description: Transforms into Werewolf

Name: Werewolf
Description: Transforms into Werehuman

Name: Wisp
Description: Produces 1 $M every turn
Lore: Eo, eo, eo.

Name: Kraken
Description: You must have at least 3 other mythical creatures to place the Kraken into play

Name: Leprechaun Pendant
Lore: Humans believe in luck and in circumstances.; We believe in cause and effect.

Name: Lexico Innaturale
Description: +1 \C for each race present in the game (excluding spells), own or enemy
Lore: There are many different worlds in this universe. Some typical, others very strange and unnatural.

Name: Mandrake
Lore: Powdered moonstone, syrup of hellebore, crushed pearls, ashwinder eggs, squill bulb, and root of mandrake. Slowly stir while boiling. If done right, you get a powerful love poition. But a single misstep and you get poison. Think carefully who you give it to.

Name: Resurrection Stone
Description: Can give to already dead creature; Turn end: resurrect the wearer, if dead; Immediately win if you have all three deathly hallows

Name: Transfiguration
Description: Rearrange resource tokens between all your cards that can store them; Changing type of tokens is allowed
Lore: Turning water into wine is faith.; Turning copper into gold is alchemy.

Name: Mythical Race
Lore: Creatures of legend, born of myth and magic.

Name: Goblin
Description: Win combat: steal 1 $G
Lore: Judge me by my size, do you?

Name: Oliphaunt
Description: Two killing actions within one turn are required to kill the Oliphaunt
Lore: And so it was that in the hour of need the great elephants, guided by the magic of the wizards, were arrayed in final battle to break the lines of our foes, and their trumpeting filled the air.

Name: Troll
Lore: Left head: 'This way!'; Right head: 'No, that way!'

Name: Gul'dan
Description: Sacrifice (remove from game) a number of own creatures; Permanently grant +1 \M to all own orc creatures for every sacrificed creature
Lore: The necrolytes have served their purpose. Now they shall have a new one, an even greater one. Gather our implements.

Name: Sauron
Description: Place additional Goblin; Opponent plays with their hand revealed
Lore: Sorcerer of dreadful power, master of shadows and of phantoms, foul in wisdom, cruel in strength, misshaping what he touched, twisting what he ruled. His dominion was torment.

Name: Thrall
Description: Final: choose two attributes (\M/\C/\F) and exchange their values.
Lore: A risky plan, but what is life without risk, eh?; For the Horde!

Name: Bone Dagger
Lore: Embrace the darkness within and make offerings in blood and flesh.

Name: Fel Magic
Description: Game end: kill the creature holding Fel Magic
Lore: It promises great power, but it exacts a terrible price.

Name: Meat
Description: +2 \M and -2 \C if given to an orc
Lore: Looks like meat's back on the menu, boys.

Name: Poison
Description: Give to enemy creature
Lore: Coward's weapon.

Name: Spikes
Description: +2 \M if given to an orc
Lore: Pointy end towards the enemy.

Name: Berserker
Description: Combat: target own creature. That creature has doubled \M. The creature is killed at the end of the combat.

Name: Orc Race
Lore: Brutish, aggressive, ugly, and malevolent race of monsters, descended from a corruption of elves.

Name: Graveyard
Description: Gain 1 $M whenever a creature is killed, own or enemy
Lore: Humans check in. They don't check out.

Name: Tomb
Description: Gain 2 $G
Lore: Most people disdain gravedigging.; Undead call it recycling.

Name: Ghost
Lore: I'm invisible, gaseous, and deadly.

Name: Lich
Description: Produces 1 $M every turn
Lore: I always wanted to start my own religion... so I did!

Name: Mummy
Lore: Just a glorified roll of toilet paper.

Name: Skeleton
Description: Spend 1 $M to transform into Zombie
Lore: No guts, no gore.

Name: Spectre
Description: Game end: target a creature, own or enemy; The spectre has same attributes as printed on the target
Lore: Vampires have no reflection in mirrors, so they use spectres instead.

Name: Vampire
Description: Turn end: spend 1 $M to steal a resource token from enemy
Lore: I'm having a mid-death crisis.

Name: Zombie
Description: Cannot be placed directly
Lore: Slow, but they never tire, never stop, and never give up.

Name: Balon Greyjoy
Description: Undead creatures and buildings cannot be killed
Lore: What is dead may never die, but rises again, harder and stronger.

Name: Dracula
Description: Spend 1 $M to transform one non-undead creature, own or enemy, into any undead creature; (This effect is played in Transformations phase)
Lore: Do not waste life on those who do not deserve it.

Name: Plague
Description: Combat: all enemy non-undead creatures have -1 \M, +1 \F
Lore: You may pray, but without breath you cannot fight.

Name: Raise Undead
Description: Place additional Skeleton for every $M spent on this spell
Lore: Necromancy is not for the faint of heart. It requires a strong will and a steady hand, for the dead are not always cooperative.

Name: Rotten Paper
Description: Enemy player discards 3 random cards from their hand
Lore: Rotten "paper" - made by undead.; What do you think it is made of?; It is not bones, you know.

Name: Will-o-the-wisp
Description: Combat: target enemy non-undead creature; That creature does not participate in this combat
Lore: Not all that glitters is gold.

Name: Undead Race
Description: Undead creatures cannot have any items
Lore: Technically dead, but still animate.
